page.title: 06Roadside Verge,Rutland
page.content: A conserved verge is situated between Ayston and Ridlington and is called 81E the E being the eastern edge of the road.It is rated by the Leicestershire Museum Service at 'DISTRICT LEVEL'i.e not as important as 'COUNTY LEVEL'but more important than 'PARISH LELEL'. Sixty-five plant species have been recorded from the verge which lie on the sides of a shallow valley, approximatley between 140m contours.A culvert carrying an unnamed stream runs under the road at the lowest point;this stream is the parish boundry.The verge consists of a band of herbaceous plants near the road side,with a shrub band on the field side of the verge.The latter contains field maple,hazel and guelder rose.Dog's Mercury also occurs on the verge.
